title-group.article-title: Weak Coupling of Solutions of First-Order Least-Squares Method

abstract.p: A theoretical analysis of a first-order least-squares finite element method for second-order self-adjoint elliptic problems is presented. We investigate the coupling effect of the approximate solutions <tex-math>$u_h$</tex-math> for the primary function u and <tex-math>$\sigma _h $</tex-math> for the flux σ = —A▽u. We prove that the accuracy of the approximate solution <tex-math>$u_h$</tex-math> for the primary function u is weakly affected by the flux σ = — A▽u. That is, the bound for <tex-math>$\parallel u - u_h \parallel _1$</tex-math> is dependent on σ, but only through the best approximation for σ multiplied by a factor of meshsize h. Similarly, we provide that the bound for <tex-math>$\left\| {\sigma - \sigma_h } \right\|_{H(div)}$</tex-math> is dependent on u, but only through the best approximation for u multiplied by a factor of the meshsize h. This weak coupling is not true for the non-selfadjoint case. We provide the numerical experiment supporting the theorems in this paper.
